column2: NEW YORK DMV TEST
column4: New York
column6: NY

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. If the entrance lane is too short to allow acceleration to highway speed, you should:
column4: stop and wait for a large gap in traffic, then enter the highway and accelerate quickly.
column6: go to the next entrance ramp.
column8: merge into highway traffic as soon as possible.

column2: 2. If your front wheels start to skid, the first thing you should do is:
column4: Take your foot off the gas pedal and shift to neutral.
column6: Immediately turn in the direction you want to go.
column8: Speed up, pump your brakes and steer in the direction the vehicle is trying to go.

column2: 3. Higher fines and increased license penalties may result from a third or subsequent alcohol-related conviction within:
column4: 2 years.
column6: 10 years.
column8: 5 years.

column2: 4. You ________ traffic headed toward you when you turn left.
column4: must yield to
column6: can handle
column8: must not yield to

column2: 5. HOV stands for:
column4: High Octane Vehicle
column6: Heavy Occupancy Vehicles
column8: High Occupancy Vehicles

column2: 6. Your BAC depends on:
column4: how much time passes between drinks.
column6: your weight.
column8: how much alcohol you drink.

column2: 7. Which of the following contains more alcohol?
column4: 12 oz. of wine cooler
column6: 5 oz. of wine
column8: 1½ oz. of liquor
column10: All these drinks contain about the same amount of alcohol.

column2: 8. Drivers can not pass a vehicle on the left if:
column4: their lane has a solid yellow center line.
column6: they can not safely return to the right lane before any oncoming vehicle comes within 200 feet of them.
column8: they approach a curve on a two-way road and can not see around it.

column2: 9. To drive defensively, you must:
column4: assume that a driver who approaches a STOP sign on a side road is actually going to stop.
column6: not check behind you through your mirrors.
column8: anticipate errors by other drivers.
column10: use only one hand on the wheel.

column2: 10. This sign means:
column4: You can only park between 8:30 AM and 5:30 PM.
column6: Parking is not allowed at 8:30 AM and at 5:30 PM
column8: No parking between 8:30 AM and 5:30 PM.

column2: 11. An emergency vehicle that uses lights and a siren can be unpredictable. Why?
column4: Emergency vehicle drivers are not required to be careful.
column6: The driver can legally pass red lights.
column8: Emergency vehicles must go faster than the posted speed limit when it is safe to do so.

column2: 12. A yellow arrow means:
column4: If you intend to turn in the direction of the arrow, be prepared to stop.
column6: Do not go in the direction of the arrow.
column8: The same as a steady yellow light.

column2: 13. You can not make a turn at a red light if:
column4: you are the driver of a school bus containing pupils.
column6: you are in New York City.
column8: there is a NO TURN ON RED sign posted.

column2: 14. The following symptoms are associated with drowsy driving:
column4: You continue to yawn.
column6: Your eyes go out of focus by themselves.
column8: You don’t remember driving the last few miles.

column2: 15. This sign indicates:
column4: Winding road. Drive with caution.
column6: Warning: drunk drivers.
column8: The road may be slippery when wet. Drive slowly.
column10: Double curve ahead. Slow your speed.

column2: 16. Does the New York State law allow drivers to plea bargain to an offense related to alcohol or drugs?
column4: Yes, but only if it is your first conviction.
column6: No, never.
column8: Yes, but only if you are under 21 years of age.

column2: 17. HOV lanes:
column4: are reserved for trucks 3,000 pounds or more.
column6: are reserved for High Octane Vehicles.
column8: promote the most efficient use of limited street and highway capacity.

column2: 18. What does this road sign indicate?
column4: Drivers have the right of way over bikes turning left.
column6: Vehicles turning left must yield to bikes entering a right turn lane.
column8: Motor vehicles entering an exclusive right-turn lane must weave across bicycle traffic in bicycle lanes.

column2: 19. This sign indicates:
column4: a cross road.
column6: a no passing zone.
column8: a church zone ahead.

column2: 20. Two-thirds of all deer-vehicle collisions occur between the months of:
column4: January and March.
column6: June and August.
column8: August and October.
